nodes.description: Stream audio and video into your Gabber flow
Stores and manages conversation context messages
Creates new context messages with specified role and content
Manages conversation context for language models
Automatically converts data between compatible types
Send and receive responses from any OpenAI-compatible language model
Converts text to speech using Gabber's native TTS model
Outputs audio and video to the end user

value.value: ## Here is the same workflow we just saw, but expanded outside of the subgraph.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value: ### We manually construct our system message, and create a user message using the transcribed audio.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value:
### Triggers
#### Here we are using Trigger. Triggers are a foundational type in Gabber. They act as the impulses that power your application.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value:
### Here we are using triggers to tell our inference nodes, `OpenAICompatibleLLM` and `TTS` when to start and stop inference.

### We start our LLM when a new user message is submitted, and we cancel our LLM/TTS generation when our STT model detects the user has started talking again.
